reg:regulation.reg:title:
School Tax Exemptions and Refunds
(Approved and Eligible Hydroelectric
Power Projects) Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: authority has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Hydro and Power Authority Act;
listed facility means a facility in Column 3 in the attached Schedule;
professional engineer means a person who is registered under the Professional Governance Act as a professional engineer or professional licensee engineering.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Approved class of alternative energy power projects
bcl:section.bcl:text: Hydroelectric power projects are approved alternative energy power projects for purposes of section 131.1 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: What types of approved hydroelectric power projects are eligible for school tax exemptions and refunds?

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this regulation, the following are designated as eligible hydroelectric power projects for purposes of this regulation:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a newer run-of-river hydroelectric power project if the head pond storage capacity of the power project is no more than 24 hours of average annual flow;
a newer hydroelectric power project that is not a run-of-river hydroelectric power project described in paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A newer run-of-river hydroelectric power project under subsection (1) (a) or a newer hydroelectric power project under subsection (1) (b) is one that did not begin production of electricity before January 1, 2002.
Subject to section 5, the following improvements in respect of an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3 (1) (a) are exempt from school taxes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: penstocks, penstock foundations and penstock support structures;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 5, the following improvements in respect of an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3 (1) (b) are exempt from school taxes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: penstocks, penstock foundations and penstock support structures.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Nothing in subsection (2) provides a school tax exemption for a dam, a weir or any part of either.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Are there conditions to be met to get the exemption?

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an exemption from school taxes under section 4 does not apply in a taxation year unless the eligible hydroelectric power project is at a listed facility or the following conditions are met:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the eligible hydroelectric power project is, as of October 31 in the year preceding the taxation year,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: licensed to display the EcoLogoTM certified by Underwriters Laboratories, and
a current licensee in good standing with that program, as confirmed by the owner or a senior executive officer of the power project;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the eligible hydroelectric power project is one referred to in section 3 (1) (a), a professional engineer has certified that, as of October 31 in the year preceding the taxation year, the head pond storage capacity of the power project is no more than 24 hours of average annual flow.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), the conditions in subsection (1) (a) do not apply to an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3 (1) (a) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the power project has, as of October 31 in the year preceding the taxation year referred to in subsection (1), a contract with the authority to sell the authority power produced by the power project,
the contract referred to in paragraph (a) was made before January 1, 2005 and its term is no less than 10 years from the date it was made, and
the owner or a senior executive officer of the power project confirms the facts described in paragraphs (a) and (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (4), and in addition to the conditions and requirements set out in subsections (1) and (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a confirmation under subsection (1) (a) (ii) or (2) (c) must be

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: made to the assessor of the assessment area in which the power project is located, and
made by November 30 in the year preceding the taxation year in which the exemption is to apply, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of a certificate under subsection (1) (b) must be provided

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to the assessor of the assessment area in which the power project is located, and
by November 30 in the year preceding the taxation year in which the exemption is to apply.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (3) does not apply in respect of a listed facility.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: School tax refunds for previous taxation years

bcl:definition.bcl:text: final determination under the Assessment Act means a determination on the assessment roll for a taxation year, subject to any change that is finally determined under the Assessment Act by revised assessment roll, by supplementary assessment roll or on further appeal;

first exempt taxation year means, in relation to an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3, the first taxation year in which the power project's improvements are, on a final determination under the Assessment Act, exempt under section 4 as a result of being a listed facility or of meeting the conditions set out in section 5 (1) (a) and (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, if on a final determination under the Assessment Act improvements of an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3 become exempt under section 4 as a result of being a listed facility or of meeting the conditions set out in section 5 (1) (a) and (b), the minister of revenue may, on application by the taxpayer, refund to the taxpayer school taxes paid by the taxpayer before the first exempt taxation year.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the eligible hydroelectric power project is one referred to in section 3 (1) (a), the refund under subsection (2) of this section is limited to the school taxes previously paid by the taxpayer in respect of the improvements referred to in section 4 (1),

if the eligible hydroelectric power project is one referred to in section 3 (1) (b), the refund under subsection (2) of this section is limited to the school taxes previously paid by the taxpayer in respect of the improvements referred to in section 4 (2), and
the refund is limited to those school taxes paid by the taxpayer in the 3 taxation years immediately preceding the first exempt taxation year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for a school tax refund under this section may not be made more than 3 years after January 1 of the first exempt taxation year.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: School Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 412, s. 131.1.]
